flavor: The densest information cluster in the galaxy.
stripped_text: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
text: Your maximum hand size is equal to the number of credits in your credit pool.
title: Cerebral Imaging: Infinite Frontiers

flavor: The Once and Future Android.
stripped_text: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.
text: You cannot include Jinteki cards in this deck.
title: Custom Biotics: Engineered for Success

stripped_text: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.
text: Before taking your first turn, you may install up to 3 pieces of ice, with no more than a single piece of ice per server. Draw until you have 5 cards in HQ.
title: NEXT Design: Guarding the Net

stripped_text: When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs. Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.
text:
When you score Director Haas' Pet Project, you may create a new remote server by installing up to 3 cards from HQ and/or Archives in that server and/or protecting that server (one at a time), ignoring all install costs.
Limit 1 Director Haas' Pet Project per deck.
title: Director Haas' Pet Project

stripped_text: Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it. click, hosted agenda counter: Gain click click. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.
text: Place 3 agenda counters on Efficiency Committee when you score it. [click], hosted agenda counter: Gain [click][click]. You cannot advance cards for the remainder of this turn.
title: Efficiency Committee

stripped_text: Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "Subroutine End the run." after all its other subroutines.
text: Place 3 agenda counters on Project Wotan when you score it. Hosted agenda counter: Choose a rezzed piece of bioroid ice currently being approached. For the remainder of this run, that ice gains "[subroutine] End the run." after all its other subroutines.
title: Project Wotan

flavor: "Why limit our best assets to our own servers? The enemy doesn't stay passively at home, waiting for us to come to him. Why should we?" -Director Haas
stripped_text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.
text: Whenever the Runner suffers at least 1 brain damage, do 1 net damage.
title: Sentinel Defense Program

flavor: The Alix model was based on a successful hedge fund manager but she had a tendency to burn out. Literally.
stripped_text: Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card. click,trash: Gain 2 credits for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.
text:
Place 1 power counter on Alix T4LB07 whenever you install a card.
[click],[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each power counter on Alix T4LB07.
title: Alix T4LB07

stripped_text: You can advance this asset. When the Runner accesses this asset, you may pay 3 credits. If you do, do 1 brain damage for each hosted advancement token.
text:
You can advance this asset.
When the Runner accesses this asset, you may pay 3[credit]. If you do, do 1 brain damage for each hosted advancement token.
title: Cerebral Overwriter

stripped_text: You have 1 additional click to spend during your turn. If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points. Errata from FAQ 3.1
text:
You have 1 additional [click] to spend during your turn.
If Director Haas is trashed while being accessed, add her to the Runner's score area as an agenda worth 2 agenda points.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 3.1</errata>
title: Director Haas

stripped_text: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. click, hosted advancement token: Gain click click. Use this ability only once per turn.
text: Haas Arcology AI can be advanced only while unrezzed. [click], hosted advancement token: Gain [click][click]. Use this ability only once per turn.
title: Haas Arcology AI

flavor: Thomas, the director's son, has been carefully groomed to inherit the corporation since before he was born. His favorite pastime appears to be disappointing his mother.
stripped_text: Thomas Haas can be advanced. trash: Gain 2 credits for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.
text:
Thomas Haas can be advanced.
[trash]: Gain 2[credit] for each advancement token on Thomas Haas.
title: Thomas Haas

stripped_text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
text: Rez a piece of bioroid ice, ignoring all costs, and install Bioroid Efficiency Research on that ice as a hosted condition counter with the text "Trash Bioroid Efficiency Research and derez host ice if all of its subroutines are broken during a single encounter."
title: Bioroid Efficiency Research

flavor: Success is defined by the safety of data, not the safety of potential intruders.
stripped_text: Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn. Gain 7 credits.
text:
Play only if the Runner made an unsuccessful run during his or her last turn.
Gain 7[credit].
title: Successful Demonstration

flavor: The realm beyond is still forbidden.
stripped_text: The Runner can spend click click to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0. Subroutine Do 1 brain damage. Subroutine Do 1 brain damage and end the run. Subroutine End the run.
text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Heimdall 2.0.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] Do 1 brain damage and end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Heimdall 2.0

flavor: "Yeah. It made a loud noise, I got scared, and I jacked out. I still think I made the right decision." -g00ru
stripped_text: Subroutine You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
text: [subroutine] You may install and rez a piece of bioroid ice from HQ or Archives, ignoring all costs, placing it directly behind Howler. If you do, derez that piece of ice and trash Howler after the run is completed.
title: Howler

flavor: The game has changed.
stripped_text: The Runner can spend click click to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0. Subroutine Trash 1 program. Subroutine Trash 1 program. Subroutine Trace 3 If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
text:
The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Ichi 2.0.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] Trash 1 program.
[subroutine] <trace>Trace 3</trace> If successful, give the Runner 1 tag and do 1 brain damage.
title: Ichi 2.0

flavor: Sometimes you just have to guess.
stripped_text: Subroutine You may install a piece of ice from HQ as the outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
text: [subroutine] You may install a piece of ice from HQ as the outermost piece of ice protecting this server, ignoring all install costs.
title: Minelayer

stripped_text: The Runner can spend click click to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. Subroutine Trace 2 If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. Subroutine End the run.
text: The Runner can spend [click][click] to break up to 2 subroutines on Viktor 2.0. Hosted power counter: Do 1 brain damage. [subroutine] Trace 2 If successful, place 1 power counter on Viktor 2.0. [subroutine] End the run.
title: Viktor 2.0

flavor: A mind of meat! How does it work?
stripped_text: The Runner can spend click to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0. Subroutine If the Runner has spent at least 1click to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage. Subroutine If the Runner has spent at least 1click to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
text:
The Runner can spend [click] to break any subroutine on Zed 1.0.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1[click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
[subroutine] If the Runner has spent at least 1[click] to break a subroutine during this run, do 1 brain damage.
title: Zed 1.0

stripped_text: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece is installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7 credits, to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.
text: Awakening Center can host bioroid ice (each piece is installed facedown, ignoring all install costs). Whenever the Runner passes all of the ice protecting this server, you may rez a piece of ice on Awakening Center, lowering the rez cost by 7[credit], to force the Runner to encounter it. Trash that ice after the run is completed.
title: Awakening Center

stripped_text: Interrupt  When a subroutine would be broken on bioroid ice protecting this server, you may rez this upgrade. trash: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server. Errata from CR 1.4
text: [interrupt] – When a subroutine would be broken on bioroid ice protecting this server, you may rez this upgrade. [trash]: Prevent a subroutine from being broken on a piece of bioroid ice protecting this server. Errata from CR 1.4
title: Tyr's Hand

flavor: Sell the dream-show them how very much they want to be rich, and they'll convince themselves that someday, they will be. How can they revolt against their future selves? -the New Gospel of Wealth
stripped_text: click, click: Gain 3 credits.
text: [click], [click]: Gain 3[credit].
title: Gila Hands Arcology

flavor: "Just another factory, making good corporate drones for the machine. Their CS department is the best in the world, though." -g00ru
stripped_text: click, 1 credit: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
text: [click], 1[credit]: Search R&D for a piece of ice, reveal it, and add it to HQ. Shuffle R&D.
title: Levy University

flavor: "There's only a 5% chance this could result in a general failure."
stripped_text: Gain 2 credits when your turn begins. Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
text:
Gain 2[credit] when your turn begins.
Trash Server Diagnostics when you install a piece of ice.
title: Server Diagnostics

flavor: The principle behind ice is not to keep everyone out, but to let only some people in. This ice denies entry on all but a select few ports that might change with the time of day or picosecond of connection. If you don't know what port to use, you're not getting in. Period.
stripped_text: Subroutine End the run.
text: [subroutine] End the run.
title: Bastion

flavor: "Cheap, off-the-shelf data protection. Cheap for them, that is. Not for us." -Ele "Smoke" Scovak
stripped_text: Subroutine The Runner must pay 2 credits, if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2 credits, end the run. Subroutine End the run.
text:
[subroutine] The Runner must pay 2[credit], if able. If the Runner cannot pay 2[credit], end the run.
[subroutine] End the run.
title: Datapike

flavor: "I was not; I was; I am not; I am all."
stripped_text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of this run.
text: The first time each turn you encounter a piece of ice, it gains code gate for the remainder of this run.
title: Rielle "Kit" Peddler: Transhuman

flavor: "New technology destroys the old."
stripped_text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.
text: The first copy of each program in this deck does not count against your influence limit.
title: The Professor: Keeper of Knowledge

flavor: "I can make that work."
stripped_text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.
text: Whenever you install a program from your heap, draw 1 card.
title: Exile: Streethawk

stripped_text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.
text: Make a run on HQ. If successful, instead of accessing cards, rearrange any number of ice protecting all servers (without rezzing or derezzing the ice). The same number of ice must be protecting each server after the rearrangement as before.
title: Escher

flavor: Wheeeee!
stripped_text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.
text: Make a run. If successful, instead of accessing cards, remove up to 3 advancement tokens from a single card in or protecting the attacked server.
title: Exploratory Romp

flavor: "Idealism's great, but it don't keep you in soybeef tacos." -Matt "TheMerc" Thomas
stripped_text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2 credits for each program trashed.
text: Trash up to 5 programs from your grip. Gain 2[credit] for each program trashed.
title: Freelance Coding Contract

flavor: One man's trash.
stripped_text: Trash an installed program. If you do, install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed. Errata from FAQ 4.0
text:
Trash an installed program.
If you do, install a program from your grip or heap, lowering the install cost of that program by the cost of the program trashed.
<errata>Errata from FAQ 4.0</errata>
title: Scavenge

flavor: Spend too much time in the AR Lab and someone might notice. Unless you're the head of it, that is.
stripped_text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.
text: Shuffle your grip and heap into your stack. Draw 5 cards. Remove Levy AR Lab Access from the game instead of trashing it.
title: Levy AR Lab Access

stripped_text: +3 mu When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4 credits. Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.
text: +3[mu] When you install Monolith, install up to 3 programs from your grip, lowering the install cost of each by 4[credit]. Trash a program from your grip: Prevent 1 brain or net damage. Limit 1 console per player.
title: Monolith

flavor: It still hurts, a bit, the first time. The second time, you feel nothing at all. But don't push your luck.
stripped_text: 3 credits: Prevent 1 net damage. trash: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
text:
3[credit]: Prevent 1 net damage.
[trash]: Prevent up to 2 brain damage.
title: Feedback Filter

flavor: It is good practice to backup the backup.
stripped_text: trash: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
text: [trash]: Install a program from your heap (paying the install cost).
title: Clone Chip

stripped_text: Omni-drive can host a single program of 1 mu or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit. 1 recurring credit Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.
text:
Omni-drive can host a single program of 1[mu] or less. The memory cost of the hosted program does not count against your memory limit.
1[recurring-credit]
Use this credit to pay for using the hosted program.
title: Omni-drive

flavor: We are shaped by our thoughts; we become what we think.
stripped_text: When you install this program, you may pay X credits to place X power counters on it. This program gets +1 strength for each hosted power counter, and it can only interface with ice of exactly equal strength. Interface > 1 credit: Break 1 subroutine.
text:
When you install this program, you may pay X[credit] to place X power counters on it.
This program gets +1 strength for each hosted power counter, and it can only interface with ice of exactly equal strength.
Interface > 1[credit]: Break 1 subroutine.
title: Atman

flavor: "No line that they lay could catch a shadow on the wall…"
stripped_text: 1 recurring credit Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
text: 1[recurring-credit] Use this credit to pay for using icebreakers.
title: Cloak

flavor: "…and once the shadow rises, the curtain shall fall." -revenant
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break sentry subroutine. 1 credit: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
text: 1[credit]: Break sentry subroutine. 1[credit]: +5 strength. Use this ability only by spending a credit from a stealth card.
title: Dagger

stripped_text: Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana. If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
text:
Whenever you make a successful run on R&D, place 1 virus counter on Chakana.
If there are at least 3 virus counters on Chakana, the advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
title: Chakana

stripped_text: 1 credit: Break code gate subroutine. 1 credit: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can be used only during a run on the chosen server.
text: 1[credit]: Break code gate subroutine. 1[credit]: +1 strength. When you install Cyber-Cypher, choose a server. Cyber-Cypher can be used only during a run on the chosen server.
title: Cyber-Cypher

flavor: Perfect for flooding servers.
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs of assets.
text: 2[recurring-credit] (When you install this card and before your turn begins, refill to 2 hosted credits.) You can spend hosted credits to pay trash costs of assets.
title: Paricia

flavor: "Make sure you tell the source code which executable you want it to compile into. One time I left my rig for a couple of minutes, and when I came back all of my files had been replaced with cat vids." -The Professor
stripped_text: 2 credits, trash: Search your stack for a program. Install it.
text: 2[credit], [trash]: Search your stack for a program. Install it.
title: Self-modifying Code

flavor: Out there, the thousand-petaled lotus symbolizes detachment from illusion. In here, it is the birthplace of a higher consciousness. Something infinitely pure.
stripped_text: 2 recurring credits Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).
text:
2[recurring-credit]
Use these credits to install programs (you cannot use Sahasrara to install a program that trashes Sahasrara).
title: Sahasrara

flavor: "The Incans believed that the sun god resided in the Haman Pacha, the upper realm of the cosmos. They just didn't know that the Haman Pacha hadn't been discovered yet." -The Professor
stripped_text: 1 credit: Break barrier subroutine. 2 credits: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
text: 1[credit]: Break barrier subroutine. 2[credit]: +1 strength for the remainder of this run.
title: Inti

flavor: Sometimes it doesn't matter how expensive your rig is, or how many credits are in your account, or even your skill as a runner. Most of the time, a simple handshake and a name are all you need.
stripped_text: click: Gain 1 credit and draw 1 card.
text: [click]: Gain 1[credit] and draw 1 card.
title: Professional Contacts

flavor: Some people have their own satellite receiver. Others have their own satellite.
stripped_text: +1 link Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
text:
+1[link]
Your maximum hand size is increased by 1.
title: Borrowed Satellite

flavor: "If you know the source code you can write to beat it, or just rejigger it a little and make it yours. That works, too." -Exile
stripped_text: Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1 credit on Ice Analyzer. You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
text:
Whenever the Corp rezzes a piece of ice, place 1[credit] on Ice Analyzer.
You may use credits on Ice Analyzer to install programs.
title: Ice Analyzer

flavor: The data was better than she could have ever imagined. This Santiago fellow really knew what he was doing. She began to imagine the havoc she could wreak at the upcoming charity dinner…
stripped_text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was successful, gain 5 credits.
text: Run any server. When that run ends, if it was successful, gain 5[credit].
title: Dirty Laundry

flavor: "We say 'cyber-terrorist', they hear 'underground celebrity.'" -Michael Muhama, professional expert
stripped_text: When you install this resource, load 8 credits onto it. When it is empty, trash it. When your turn begins, take 2 credits from this resource.
text:
When you install this resource, load 8[credit] onto it. When it is empty, trash it.
When your turn begins, take 2[credit] from this resource.
title: Daily Casts

flavor: Just me, a cup of YucaBean, and last night's Hong Kong Trunk sniffed packets. I call that a good morning.
stripped_text: click, click, trash: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).
text: [click], [click], [trash]: Play an event from your heap (paying its play cost).
title: Same Old Thing

flavor: A dangerous game, but well worth playing.
stripped_text: The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1. As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3 credits. Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.
text:
The advancement requirement of all agendas is increased by 1.
As an additional cost to steal an agenda, you must pay 3[credit].
Trash The Source when an agenda is scored or stolen.
title: The Source
